item.title: NJ Congresswoman Charged With Assault in ICE Protest, Prosecutor Says
item.description: The US Justice Department charged a Democratic House lawmaker from Newark, New Jersey, with assault after a confrontation with US immigration officers, while dropping a trespassing charge against the mayor arising from the same incident.
item.dc:creator: David Voreacos, Chris Strohm, Ellen M Gilmer

media:content.media:description: LaMonica McIver Photographer:Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc/Getty Images

item.title: US Clears Way for Tariffs on $13 Billion of Solar Imports
item.description: US duties on solar equipment from four Southeast Asian countries are now set to take effect, following a government agency’s conclusion that the imports threaten domestic manufacturers.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Mark Chediak

media:content.media:description: A worker handles photovoltaic cells at Irex Energy JSC's manufacturing facility in Vung Tau, Vietnam, on Monday, July 15, 2019. After U.S. President Donald Trump slapped higher tariffs on China, production in neighboring Vietnam went into overdrive. Chinese manufacturers, who face a 55% U.S. tariff on their goods, relocated some production to Vietnam, while local businesses saw a jump in orders. In June alone, U.S. imports of solar cells from Vietnam surged 656% from a year ago.

item.title: Mexico City Mayor’s Aides Shot Dead by Attackers on Motorbikes
item.description: Two close aides of Mexico City Mayor Clara Brugada were shot dead by assailants on a motorbike, President Claudia Sheinbaum told reporters, in the latest politically tinged killings to rock the country.
item.dc:creator: Carolina Millan

media:content.media:description: The monumental Mexican flag of San Jeronimo Lidice in the south of Mexico City, Mexico, on Thursday, Sept. 22, 2022. Mexico's inflation came in above expectations in early September, giving the central bank minimal room to reduce the pace of interest rate hikes at its meeting on September 29. Photographer: Cesar Rodriguez/Bloomberg

item.title: UK Pauses Israel Trade Talks and Issues Sanctions Over Gaza
item.description: The UK announced a series of measures to punish Israel over its actions in Gaza, joining international efforts to ramp up pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
item.dc:creator: William Selway

media:content.media:description: Shipping containers at London Gateway port. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: South Africa Weighs More Borrowing After Tax Hike Plan Dropped
item.description: South Africa’s National Treasury is considering raising additional borrowing in its latest rendition of the budget, to be delivered on Wednesday, to cover a revenue shortfall after a plan to increase taxes was scrapped.
item.dc:creator: S'thembile Cele

media:content.media:description: Enoch Godongwana, South Africa's finance minister, presents the revised 2025 Budget at the National Assembly in Cape Town, South Africa, on Wednesday, March 12, 2025. Godongwana and his National Treasury officials were sent back to the drawing board last month after his revenue and spending plan failed to get buy-in from parties.

item.title: Trump Reversed His NY Wind Farm Stance After Hochul Agreed to Pipelines
item.description: The Trump administration is allowing construction to resume on a $5 billion wind farm off Long Island after reaching a deal with New York Governor Kathy Hochul that could allow new natural gas pipelines to be built in the state.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Laura Nahmias, Josh Saul

media:content.media:description: A rendering of Equinor’s Empire Wind 1 project

item.title: US Set to Extend Chevron Venezuela Waiver by Another 60 Days
item.description: The Trump administration is set to extend Chevron Corp.’s deadline to halt its operations in Venezuela by another 60 days as the US continues negotiations with President Nicolas Maduro’s government over repatriation flights and the fate of US detainees in the country, a person familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Fabiola Zerpa, Nick Wadhams

media:content.media:description: A pump jack stands near an oil spill at a Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA) facility in the Orinoco Belt of El Tigre, Venezuela, on Friday, Oct. 12, 2018. State-owned PDVSA doesn't publish statistics, but environmentalists and analysts keep seemingly endless lists of examples of wayward crude - unleashed by busted valves, ripped gaskets, and cracked pipes - that they say has polluted waterways and farmland and probably has seeped into the nation's aquifers. Photographer: Bloomberg/Bloomberg

item.title: Pakistan Promotes Army Chief After Conflict With India
item.description: Pakistan promoted its army chief to field marshal to mark the country’s success in the most serious military confrontation with India in half a century this month.
item.dc:creator: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Khalid Qayum

media:content.media:description: A man carries a portrait of Pakistani Army Chief General Syed Asim Munir, during a rally to express solidarity with Pakistan's armed forces, in Islamabad on May 14, 2025.

item.title: UK Considers Reducing Cash Portion of £20,000 ISA Allowance
item.description: The UK government is planning to reduce the amount of cash that savers can put in tax-free accounts, according to a Treasury minister.
item.dc:creator: Philip Aldrick, Leonard Kehnscherper

media:content.media:description: Emma Reynolds

item.title: Trump Pushes SALT Republicans to Abandon Further Cap Hike
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday pushed back on demands from Republicans who have threatened to sink his giant tax bill if the legislation does not significantly boost the state and local tax deduction, lawmakers said.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Ari Natter, Maeve Sheehey

media:content.media:description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson. Photographer: Graeme Sloan/Bloomberg

item.title: Crypto Entrepreneur Justin Sun Will Join Trump’s Memecoin Dinner
item.description: Controversial crypto entrepreneur Justin Sun announced that he’s joining a high-profile dinner with the US President Donald Trump later this week.
item.dc:creator: Muyao Shen

media:content.media:description: Justin Sun, founder of Tron and chief executive officer of BitTorrent Inc., speaks during the TOKEN2049 in Singapore, on Wednesday, on Sept. 28, 2022. The cryptocurrency event runs through Sept. 29.

item.title: European Governments Step Up Pressure on Israel Over Gaza War
item.description: European and UK officials ratcheted up pressure on Israel over its decision to deepen the military incursion in Gaza, expanding the international outcry over the humanitarian crisis caused by the conflict.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Basteiro

media:content.media:description: Israeli military vehicles at Israel's southern border with the Gaza Strip on May 20.

item.title: Uganda Lawmakers Pass Law to Try Civilians in Military Courts
item.description: Ugandan lawmakers passed a law that will allow military courts to try civilians, just three months after the supreme court ruled that such trials were illegal.
item.dc:creator: Fred Ojambo

item.title: South Africa to Offer Musk Starlink Deal Before Trump Meet
item.description: South Africa’s government plans to offer Elon Musk a workaround of local Black-ownership laws for his Starlink internet service to operate in the country, aiming to ease tensions with both the billionaire and US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo, S'thembile Cele

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk Photographer: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images North America

item.title: Surprise Supreme Court Ruling Throws 350,000 Migrants Into Uncertainty
item.description: Immigration lawyer Jodi Goodwin said her Venezuelan clients for years held onto the idea that their status in the US was stable. They had work permits and paid taxes under a US humanitarian program that offered refuge from turmoil back home.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, Fabiola Zerpa, Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: Venezuelans attend a vigil to show support for extending Temporary Protected Status in Florida on May 8. Photographer: Pedro Portal/Miami Herald/Tribune News Service/Getty Images

item.title: Musk Says He’ll Scale Back Political Spending in Blow to GOP
item.description: Elon Musk said he would significantly pull back from political spending, a likely blow to US President Donald Trump and Republicans ahead of the 2026 midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Korte, Bill Allison

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk in Green Bay, Wisconsin, US, in March.

item.title: Trump Set to Make Announcement on ‘Golden Dome’ Missile Defense
item.description: President Donald Trump is set to make a new announcement on the path forward for his ambitious and controversial plan for a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Capaccio

media:content.media:description: WASHINGTON, DC - MAY 12: White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles looks on from behind a chart on the Golden Dome missile defense system as U.S. President Donald Trump speaks during a press conference in the Roosevelt Room of the White House on May 12, 2025, in Washington, DC. During the event, President Trump signed an executive order aimed at reducing the cost of prescription drugs and pharmaceuticals by 30% to 80%. (Photo by Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)

item.title: Qatar PM Defends Plane Gift to Trump, Calling It a ‘Normal’ Transaction
item.description: Qatar defended its decision to gift a Boeing Co. 747 jumbo jet to the US as a routine transaction between partners, calling criticism of the deal a misguided view of the country as an Arab state trying to gain political influence.
item.dc:creator: Fiona MacDonald, Paul Wallace, Joumanna Bercetche

media:content.media:description: Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim Al-Thani at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha, on May 20. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

item.title: Milei Shuts Down Argentina Unit Investigating Crypto Scandal
item.description: The Argentine government dismantled the Investigative Task Force (UTI), a body created just three months ago to investigate the Libra cryptocurrency scandal and the roles of President Javier Milei and his sister Karina, according to a decree published in the official gazette.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll

media:content.media:description: Argentine President Javier Milei

item.title: Spain Says EU Must Rethink Israel Ties Due to Gaza Attacks
item.description: Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares said the European Union should use its economic ties to pressure Israel as it expands its attacks in Gaza, joining a growing international outcry at the humanitarian crisis.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Basteiro

media:content.media:description: Israeli tanks move near Israel's southern border with the Gaza, on May 20.

item.title: Bolivia Registers 10 Presidential Candidates; Morales Not Included
item.description: Socialist former leader Evo Morales failed to register for Bolivia’s upcoming presidential vote, according to the list of ten candidates published Tuesday by the electoral court.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Mendoza

media:content.media:description: Evo Morales speaks during an election campaign launch in Chapare, Cochabamba department, Bolivia, on May 10.

item.title: Polish Far-Right Kingmaker Sets Terms for Backing Candidates
item.description: Poland’s far-right leader Slawomir Mentzen has set out his conditions for endorsing one of the two candidates in a presidential election runoff on June 1 that include ruling out Ukraine’s membership in NATO.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Ojewska

media:content.media:description: Slawomir Mentzen, Presidential candidate of the far-right Confederation party, speaks to supporters as first exit polls following Presidential elections are announced in Warsaw, on May 18, 2025. (Photo by Sergei GAPON / AFP) (Photo by SERGEI GAPON/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Reeves Hints at U-Turn on Winter Fuel Cuts for Pensioners
item.description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hinted she could change course on cuts to energy subsidies for millions of British pensioners, following newspaper reports of a government U-turn on the divisive policy.
item.dc:creator: Ailbhe Rea

media:content.media:description: Rachel Reeves on May 19.

item.title: Qatar Assails Israel Over New Gaza Attacks and Lack of Aid
item.description: Qatar, a key mediator on ending the war in Gaza, criticized Israel’s latest offensive against Hamas, saying it would prolong the conflict and worsen the humanitarian situation for Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: Paul Wallace, Joumanna Bercetche, Zainab Fattah

media:content.media:description: Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha on May 20,

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Are on Their Own Now
item.description: The US president had the means to pressure Putin on Ukraine and didn’t. Now it’s the Old World’s time to choose.
item.dc:creator: Marc Champion

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump speaks during an event with law enforcement officers in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, May 19, 2025. Trump today said that Moscow and Kyiv would begin talks "immediately" on ending the war in Ukraine after a phone call with Russia's President on Monday.

item.title: White House’s Miran Dismisses Inflation Risk From Tariff Hikes
item.description: The White House’s chief economist dismissed the idea that tariff increases will have a lasting impact on US inflation, and cited the potential for interest rates to get back down to pre-Covid levels.
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse

media:content.media:description: Stephen Miran, chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers, speaks during the Hill & Valley forum at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. The Hill and Valley Forum, started in 2023, is a gathering of lawmakers and venture capitalists focused on the US technology industry.

item.title: UK Tories Fall to Fourth Place as Support Hits a Record Low
item.description: UK Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch is under pressure from a new poll showing her party’s popularity dropping to the lowest in at least 24 years, sliding to fourth place behind the Liberal Democrats.
item.dc:creator: Irina Anghel

media:content.media:description: Kemi Badenoch

item.title: Charging Installations Drop as Trump Ramps Up Attacks on EVs
item.description: The prospect of House Republicans’ cuts to electric vehicle subsidies threatens to further dim the outlook.
item.dc:creator: Tope Alake

media:content.media:description: A Flo Home electric vehicle (EV) charger at the company's assembly facility in Shawinigan, Quebec, Canada, on Wednesday, Oct. 23, 2024. Earlier this year, the company secured $136 million in long-term capital, principally from a Series E equity financing, led by Export Development Canada (EDC), to support its continued growth in both the US and Canada and accelerate the deployment of its reliable charging network.

item.title: Trump U-Turn on $5 Billion Wind Farm Lifts Ailing Industry
item.description: The Trump administration’s surprise reversal of an order to halt a $5 billion wind energy project off the coast of New York offered some respite to a beleaguered industry whose future in the US has been in doubt.
item.dc:creator: Kari Lundgren, Will Mathis

media:content.media:description: A rendering of Equinor’s Empire Wind 1 project

item.title: Germany Offers to Take the Lead On Joint EU Air Defense Projects
item.description: Germany has offered to take the lead on joint European Union projects regarding air defense, land and marine systems, Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said Tuesday, as the bloc ramps up its own military deterrent to Russian aggression.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano

media:content.media:description: Germany's defense minister Boris Pistorius in Brussels, on May 20.
